results.title: Paper War
results.creator_credit: Guan Wei, ACMI and SBS Independent

results.title: It's in the blood
results.brief_description: Sporting history runs in Darryl’s family. His grandfathers were champion cyclists Pat Veitch and Jack Forbes. His parents and his uncles also were all cycling enthusiasts and both Darryl and his brother inherited the sporting genes to become successful in athletics and football. It is this sporting background that Darryl feels has given him his values and made him what he is today.
results.description: Sporting history runs in Darryl’s family. His grandfathers were champion cyclists Pat Veitch and Jack Forbes. His parents and his uncles also were all cycling enthusiasts and both Darryl and his brother inherited the sporting genes to become successful in athletics and football. It is this sporting background that Darryl feels has given him his values and made him what he is today.

His parents and his uncles also were all cycling enthusiasts and both Darryl and his brother inherited the sporting genes to become successful in athletics and football. It is this sporting background that Darryl feels has given him his values and made him what he is today.

results.title: My Love
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Against the Grain” in association with Partners in Grain (PING).
Almost 60 years old, Maureen Barry reminisces about her life, especially the last 35 years, of living on the land with the man she loves. From her youthful dreams as a young rural bride to the often harsh realiities of farm life in the sometimes unforgiving landscape of the Mallee. This story is dedicated to her husband, Brian.

From her youthful dreams as a young rural bride to the often harsh realiities of farm life in the sometimes unforgiving landscape of the Mallee. This story is dedicated to her husband, Brian.

results.title: The Burning question
results.creator_credit: David Guy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
When David moved from the city, he fulfilled a lifetime dream to live in a place he had always visited and dreamed of owning. Losing almost all of his property, he is faced with a burning question in this first-hand account of the devastating Gippsland bushfires.
This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.

results.title: Let's talk cricket
results.creator_credit: Alice Jackson Walsh and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Alice, a Gungarri Elder from Echuca, is the former president of the Campapse Cricket Association and Warma Indigenous Cricket Club. In this warm story she reminisces about her lifelong love affair with one of our national pastimes - and reveals its social importance and grass roots support by Australians.

results.title: To my dearest beloved one - Shewitey Mearey
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. “I said to the doctor, I don’t care if I die tomorrow but I don’t want to leave my daughter alone. He said to me that first I had to live before I could have another child.”
